intro: Afrohybanthus tsavoensis, commonly known as the Tsavo hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland areas, thriving in semi-arid environments. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Afrohybanthus tsavoensis is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
